intro: Bartsia pallida, commonly known as the pale bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Bartsia pallida typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
